Line 394: Line 394:
*{{flagicon|United Kingdom}} [[United Kingdom]]'s Foreign Secretary [[William Hague]] called on the authorities and protesters in Egypt to show restraint and avoid violence. He urged the Egyptian authorities to "listen to the concerns" of demonstrators.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/news/latest-news/?view=News&id=539828682 |title=UK Foreign Secretary William Hague comment on protests in Egypt |publisher=Fco.gov.uk |date= |accessdate=28 January 2011}}</ref>
*{{flagicon|United Kingdom}} [[United Kingdom]]'s Foreign Secretary [[William Hague]] called on the authorities and protesters in Egypt to show restraint and avoid violence. He urged the Egyptian authorities to "listen to the concerns" of demonstrators.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/news/latest-news/?view=News&id=539828682 |title=UK Foreign Secretary William Hague comment on protests in Egypt |publisher=Fco.gov.uk |date= |accessdate=28 January 2011}}</ref>
â
A joint statement by Prime Minister David Cameron, President Nicolas Sarkozy and Chancellor Angela Merkel of the UK, France and Germany, respectively, read:<ref>[http://www.number10.gov.uk/latest-news/2011/01/joint-uk-france-germany-statement-on-egypt-59740 Joint UK-France-Germany statement on Egypt | Number10.gov.uk<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
+
A joint statement by Prime Minister David Cameron, President Nicolas Sarkozy and Chancellor Angela Merkel of the UK, France and Germany, respectively, read:
â
<blockquote>We are deeply concerned about the events that we are witnessing in Egypt. We recognise the moderating role President Mubarak has played over many years in the Middle East. We now urge him to show the same moderation in addressing the current situation in Egypt...It is essential that the further political, economic and social reforms President Mubarak has promised are implemented fully and quickly and meet the aspirations of the Egyptian people.The Egyptian people have legitimate grievances and a longing for a just and better future. We urge President Mubarak to embark on a process of transformation which should be reflected in a broad-based government and in free and fair elections.</blockquote>
+
  +
{{Quotation|
  +
"We are deeply concerned about the events that we are witnessing in Egypt. We recognise the moderating role President Mubarak has played over many years in the Middle East. We now urge him to show the same moderation in addressing the current situation in Egypt...It is essential that the further political, economic and social reforms President Mubarak has promised are implemented fully and quickly and meet the aspirations of the Egyptian people.The Egyptian people have legitimate grievances and a longing for a just and better future. We urge President Mubarak to embark on a process of transformation which should be reflected in a broad-based government and in free and fair elections"<ref>[http://www.number10.gov.uk/latest-news/2011/01/joint-uk-france-germany-statement-on-egypt-59740 Joint UK-France-Germany statement on Egypt | Number10.gov.uk<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
  +
